section.heading: Purpose and Scope.
section.text: This chapter describes the actions to be taken by the support enforcement agency to establish court-ordered support obligations.

section.heading: Legal Action to Establish a Support Obligation.

para.text: The support enforcement agency shall initiate legal action to establish a court-ordered support obligation for a child:
Eligible for support enforcement services; and
Who has not had a support obligation established.
If the parent of a child is a minor, the support enforcement agency may attempt to establish a court-ordered support obligation for the child against the parents of the minor parent if the:
Child for whom support is sought receives TCA; and
Minor parent has insufficient financial resources to support the child.
The support enforcement agency is not required to establish a court order for support when:
The noncustodial parent:
Cannot be located;
Receives benefits from a means tested public assistance program;
Is confined to a hospital or other care institution for the chronically, mentally, or physically ill and has no income or assets; or
Is imprisoned without earnings or assets, and is not:
Participating in an institutional work release program; and
Eligible for release before the child reaches the age of majority;
The custodial parent who receives TCA or Medical Assistance fails to cooperate with good cause;
The child is:
Married or has been married;
18 years old and is not enrolled in secondary school;
19 years old or older;
Otherwise emancipated; or
Deceased; or
Paternity cannot be established.
For any other situation not listed in §C of this regulation, the support enforcement agency, within 90 days of locating an absent parent, shall:
Establish an order for support, including a provision:
For health insurance for a child that is:
Reasonable in cost; and
Accessible for the child; or
For cash medical support that is reasonable in cost, until health insurance is available;
Complete service of process, if necessary, to commence proceedings to establish an order for support; or
Document unsuccessful attempts to serve process.
To establish a child support order, the support enforcement agency shall petition the court to:
Provide for an earnings withholding and health insurance enrollment order; and
Authorize the immediate service of the earnings withholding and health insurance enrollment order on the obligor's employer.
When taking legal action in a TCA case in which the custodial parent does not cooperate and does not have good cause, the prosecutor may:
Name the State as the plaintiff; and
File the petition.
The support enforcement agency may not attempt to establish a spousal support order.

section.heading: Review and Modification of Child Support Orders.

para.text: Notification.
Every 3 years, the Administration shall notify each parent subject to a child support order of the right to request that the Administration review the order.
The notice shall include:
A description of the method for obtaining the Administration's review of an order; and
The information that each parent must provide to the Administration.
Cases Eligible for Review.

Upon request of either parent subject to a child support order, the support enforcement agency shall conduct a review of the order for possible modification at 36-month intervals from the date the order was established, modified, or last reviewed.

In cases with an assignment of support, the support enforcement agency may conduct a review of the order for possible modification at 36-month intervals from the date the order was established, modified, or last reviewed without the request of either party.
In intergovernmental cases, the support enforcement agency shall conduct a review of the order at the request of another state if the request for a review is appropriate.
In cases that have a material change of circumstances that may result in a change of the child support order, a review may be conducted in less than the 36-month interval.
Conduct of Review.
Before conducting a review, the support enforcement agency shall gather information required for application of the Maryland child support guidelines from any of the following sources:
Federal and State automated databases to which the agencies have access;
The parties in the case;
Employers; and
Other sources as determined appropriate by the support enforcement agency.
In cases when a review is conducted, the support enforcement agency shall:

Evaluate information required for application of Maryland's child support guidelines as provided in Family Law Article, Title 12, Subtitle 2, Annotated Code of Maryland, to determine the appropriate support obligated amount; and
Determine if the order provides for a provision for health insurance or cash medical support, until health insurance is available for the child.
The support enforcement agency shall notify both parents subject to the order of the:
Outcome of the review; and
Support enforcement agency's intent regarding further action on the case.
The support enforcement agency shall initiate action to modify the support order if:
Material change in circumstance has occurred;
Modification is needed to provide for a provision for health insurance or cash medical support, until health insurance is available for the child; or
Modification is needed to extend the duration of the order to provide for support of a child who:
Is 18 years old;
Is enrolled in secondary school; and
Has not attained 19 years old.
When modifying a child support order in which the obligor is not subject to earnings withholding, the support enforcement agency shall petition the court to:
Provide for an earnings withholding;
Provide for a health insurance enrollment order, if appropriate; and
Authorize the immediate service of the earnings withholding and health insurance enrollment order on the obligor's employer.

For cases that qualify for a review, within 180 calendar days of receiving a request for a review or locating the nonrequesting parent, whichever occurs later, the support enforcement agency shall conduct a review of the order, and:
Take appropriate steps to adjust the order; or
Determine that the order should not be adjusted.

section.heading: Intergovernmental Establishment and Modification of Support Order.
section.text: When providing services in an intergovernmental case to establish or modify an order for support, the support enforcement agency shall comply with the provisions of UIFSA.
